etymology.description: 其(其) (qí, "his") + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") = foundation of earth -> final form
etymology.interpretation: The character 基(基) (jī, "foundation") combines 其(其) (qí, "his"), which serves as the phonetic component, and 土(土) (tǔ, "earth"), representing its semantic meaning of being a foundational layer or base made of earth.

examples.chinese: 建筑物的稳定依赖于坚固的基(堅固的基)。
examples.pinyin: Jiànzhùwù de wěndìng yīlài yú jiāngù de jī.
examples.english: The building's stability relies on a strong foundation.

examples.chinese: 传统智慧支撑着改革的基(傳統智慧支撐著改革的基)，现代科技推动着进步的基(現代科技推動著進步的基)。
examples.pinyin: Chuántǒng zhìhuì zhīchēng zhe gǎigé de jī, xiàndài kējì tuīdòng zhe jìnbù de jī.
examples.english: Traditional wisdom supports the foundation of reform, while modern technology drives the foundation of progress.
